arch:property.oc:show_val: Quarrying of bedrock: cut made for the cistern, canalization, the Tabun Cave Room and a well niche.

Phase IV: Nabataean Grand Design: 1st c. BCE to CE 1st c. The remainder of the subterranean canalization is installed including the East Plaza Great Cistern. The East and South Perimeter Walls are installed and Rooms A and B and the Tabun Cave Room are built into the casemate of the East Perimeter Wall. The East Plaza and South Passageway are paved and the temple Forecourt is raised and laid with a small hexagonal pavement. Residential Quarter is built in the southwest corner of the precinct. Also at this time the Central Staircase of Phase II is blocked and the lateral East and West Staircases are constructed to access the Lower Temenos.

This locus is the actual cut of the bedrock that created the room situated behind the East Perimeter Wall. As was mentioned before, the bedrock slopes downward from east to west, taking a dip of 0.10 m, and is a rather uneven floor. There is a shallow, round cut in the bedrock in its southeast corner. This is possibly a niche for resting vessels. There are some traces of burning on the wall in the southeast corner, behind where the oven/ tabun was placed, and the eastern wall of the bedrock is hewn in a diagonal hatching pattern from when it was cut. Because of the building of the East Perimeter Wall, this cutting must have been completed early in the building cycle of this portion of the precinct. See Locus 8.

Locus 1, fill, Locus 2, burn deposits, Locus 3, wall, Locus 4, wall, Locus 5, doorway, Locus 6, doorway fill, Locus 7, crushed pottery layer, Locus 9, burn deposit, Locus 10, oven/tabun, Locus 12, hard, yellow, floor buildup, Locus 30, door threshold.

Closing Elevation: Floor level for room, northwest, 1.28 m below Sub datum SP 84 B or 908.022 m; northeast 1.26 m below Sub datum SP 84 B or 908.042 m; center 1.21 m below Sub datum SP 84 B or 908.092 m; southwest 1.25 m below Sub datum SP 84 B or 908.052 m; southeast 1.15 m below Sub datum SP 84 B or 908.152 m.
Locus 17, East Perimeter Wall and Locus 4, wall in northeast corner of room.
Cut in bedrock to create room behind East Perimeter Wall
Behind, to the east of, the East Perimeter Wall.
Locus 21, lower level of the same bedrock, which is plastered to facilitate a well, and has in it a large cut for a cistern.
